documents.content:
# California Esthetician License Requirements (2026)

## Board of Barbering and Cosmetology (BBC)

### Training Requirements
- **Total Hours:** 600 hours at a BBC-approved school
- **Curriculum:** Skin care, facials, hair removal (waxing, threading), makeup application, sanitation

### Eligibility
- Age: 17 years or older
- Education: 10th grade completion or equivalent

### Examination
- **Format:** Written exam only
- **Questions:** 75 scored questions + 10 pretest questions
- **Time:** 90 minutes
- **Passing Score:** 70%
- **Languages:** English, Korean, Spanish, Vietnamese, Simplified Chinese

### Fees (2025-2026)
| Fee Type | Amount |
|----------|--------|
| Application/Exam | $75 |
| Initial License | $40 |
| Biennial Renewal | $50 |
| Delinquent Renewal | +$25 |

### Scope of Practice
Estheticians CAN perform:
- Facials and skin treatments
- Waxing, threading, tweezing
- Makeup application
- Chemical peels (superficial)
- Microdermabrasion

Estheticians CANNOT perform:
- Laser treatments (requires separate certification)
- Injections (medical procedures)
- Hair cutting or styling

### Official URL
https://www.barbercosmo.ca.gov/applicants/license_requirements.shtml

# California Manicurist (Nail Technician) License Requirements (2026)

## Board of Barbering and Cosmetology (BBC)

### Training Requirements
- **Total Hours:** 400 hours at a BBC-approved school
- **Curriculum:** Manicures, pedicures, artificial nails (acrylic, gel), nail art, sanitation

### Eligibility
- Age: 17 years or older
- Education: 10th grade completion or equivalent

### Examination
- **Format:** Written exam only
- **Questions:** 60 scored questions + 10 pretest questions
- **Time:** 90 minutes
- **Passing Score:** 70%
- **Languages:** English, Korean, Spanish, Vietnamese, Simplified Chinese

### Fees (2025-2026)
| Fee Type | Amount |
|----------|--------|
| Application/Exam | $75 |
| Initial License | $35 |
| Biennial Renewal | $50 |
| Delinquent Renewal | +$25 |

### Health & Safety Requirements
- Must use EPA-registered disinfectants
- Single-use implements or proper sterilization
- Ventilation requirements for chemical fumes
- Cal/OSHA compliance for salon workers

### Official URL
https://www.barbercosmo.ca.gov/applicants/license_requirements.shtml
